title: Print, "Winged Dragon on Bracket , from Premiere Partie Diverse Ornemens", 1745
inscribed: Inscribed on plate, upper left: A; upper right: 6; lower left: huquier Sculp. et ex a Paris rüe des Mathurins C.P.R.; lower right: Peyrotte in; inscribed in graphite, verso: les 6 feuilles/(unreadable, see object); inscribed in graphite on mount, upper right margin: n° 6.
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Large scale design with fantastical winged dragon diabolically encircling on acanthus leaf, his tongue extending from an open mouth, the tail intertwining a leafy branch. The dragon is perched on a rococo bracket, which is decorated with raffle leaves and small repetitive motifs.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Winged Dragon on Bracket , from Premiere Partie Diverse Ornemens", 1745.
1745. Etching on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-213-6.
